skill.name: exploratory-data-analysis
skill.description: Perform comprehensive exploratory data analysis on scientific data files across 200+ file formats. This skill should be used when analyzing any scientific data file to understand its structure, content, quality, and characteristics. Automatically detects file type and generates detailed markdown reports with format-specific analysis, quality metrics, and downstream analysis recommendations. Covers chemistry, bioinformatics, microscopy, spectroscopy, proteomics, metabolomics, and general scientific data formats.
skill.summary: Perform comprehensive exploratory data analysis on scientific data files across 200+ file formats. T...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Legitimate scientific data analysis skill with no malicious code. The Python script performs file analysis, statistical computations, and report generation using standard libraries. No network calls, credential access, or suspicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Scientists need to understand the structure and quality of diverse scientific data files before analysis. This skill automatically detects file types, extracts metadata, performs statistical analysis, and generates comprehensive markdown reports for 200+ scientific formats.
actual_capabilities: Automatic detection of 200+ scientific file formats across 6 categories
Extraction of format-specific metadata and structural information
Statistical analysis including distributions, summaries, and quality metrics
Generation of comprehensive markdown reports with recommendations
Support for chemistry, bioinformatics, imaging, spectroscopy, and omics formats
Analysis of tabular data, sequences, images, and array-based formats
limitations: Requires appropriate Python libraries installed for specific formats
Does not perform advanced statistical modeling or machine learning
Limited to file reading and analysis; does not modify source data
Large files may require sampling for efficient processing

use_cases.title: Quality control
use_cases.description: Assess data quality and completeness before downstream analysis for experimental datasets.

use_cases.title: Sequence data review
use_cases.description: Analyze FASTQ, FASTA, and BAM files to understand sequencing data characteristics.

use_cases.title: Spectroscopy data
use_cases.description: Examine NMR, MS, and chromatography data from analytical instruments.

prompt_templates.title: Basic file analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this scientific data file at [filepath] and generate an exploratory data analysis report.

prompt_templates.title: Quality assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Assess the quality and completeness of [filepath] and summarize key findings in a markdown report.

prompt_templates.title: Format detection
prompt_templates.prompt: What format is [filepath] and what are the main characteristics of this data?

prompt_templates.title: Multi-file analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze multiple related files in [directory] and create a summary comparison report.

output_examples.input: Analyze my_experiment.fastq and generate a quality report
output: Format: FASTQ - Sequence data with quality scores
Quality assessment: Excellent - suitable for downstream analysis
Recommendations: Proceed with alignment; no quality trimming required

best_practices: Install required scientific Python libraries (numpy, pandas, Biopython, h5py) for full format support.
Use sampling for very large files to reduce processing time while still capturing data characteristics.
Review markdown reports before proceeding with downstream analysis workflows.
anti_patterns: Using this skill on sensitive data without reviewing output for PHI or confidential information.
Expecting automated data cleaning or transformation; this skill reports on data but does not modify it.
Ignoring missing library errors; install dependencies for complete format coverage.

faq.question: What scientific formats are supported?
faq.answer: 200+ formats including FASTQ, FASTA, BAM, PDB, CIF, TIFF, ND2, CZI, mzML, NMR, HDF5, NetCDF, and many more.

faq.question: What are the size limits for analysis?
faq.answer: Large files are sampled automatically. For very large files, the script processes representative subsets while reporting file size and structure.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with my analysis pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, generate markdown reports for documentation and use extracted metadata to inform downstream processing choices.

faq.question: Is my data safe during analysis?
faq.answer: The skill reads files locally and generates reports. No data is sent externally. Review outputs before sharing to ensure no sensitive information is included.

faq.question: Why am I getting import errors?
faq.answer: Many formats require specialized libraries (Biopython for sequences, h5py for HDF5, tifffile for microscopy). Install missing packages with pip or uv.

faq.question: How does this compare to other tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-guided analysis with format-specific recommendations. It complements tools like pandas, Biopython, and scikit-image with intelligent reporting.
